isis.stitle: TSI 01-47-01 - Adjustment Procedure for the Linear Stroke Door Opening Control used in the International IC Bus Model

subjectgroup.subject: Adjustment Procedure for the Linear Stroke Door Opening Control used in the International IC Bus Model

geninfo.para: The linear stroke door opening control used in the International IC Bus model is new to the school transportation industry. The following is the service procedure for making adjustments.

step1.para: Remove the door control rod and yoke from the bracket mounted on the front panel of the entrance door by removing the "C" clip and clevis pin ( Figure 1).

caution.para: Make sure the loose door rod does not come in contact with the door glass.

step1.para: Inspect the door control yoke for restriction (clearance) with the door bracket. If the yoke is restricted (too narrow) the yoke fork can be carefully spread to add clearance ( Figure 2).

Inspect the center nosing rubber seal to insure it does not drag at the top or bottom of the door. If drag is present, trim or adjust the seal as required ( Figure 3). Exercise care not to over trim, which can cause excessive seal leakage.
Remove the ABS plastic overhead door cover.

Lubricate the top and lower entrance door hinge pins and bushings on both the front and rear door panels with a graphite based lubricant ( Figure 4). Operate the doors several times to work in the lubricant.
Loosen the connecting bar mounting brackets on the front and rear door panel ( Figure 5).

Pull the door closed allowing the door brackets to slide into position. Tighten one fastener on each bracket making sure that the brackets are straight and level. Open and close the door a few times to verify the adjustment. Tighten the remaining fasteners.
Lubricate the pivot points with a graphite based lubricant ( Figure 6). Open and close the door a few times to work in the lubricant.
Remove and set aside the right hand side dash panel by removing four fasteners along the lower edge and one fastener near the windshield center post.
Remove the four fasteners that secure the black door rod trim panel. Remove the panel.

Operate the door handle and mechanism. Verify that travel is unrestricted by loose fasteners or other impediments. Verify that the pivot plate does not bottom out against the warning light flasher switch ( Figure 7 and Figure 8).

note.para: Figure 8 is typical for outward opening doors with the warning flasher switch on the left side of the pivot plate. Forward folding doors will have the warning light flasher switch on the right side of the pivot plate.

step1.para: Inspect the three pivot bolts to verify they are not over-tightened. The washers should move freely when turned by hand. If the washers do not turn freely, adjust and lubricate with a graphite based lubricant. The primary pivot bolt will be secured by a set screw which must be loosened and tightened after adjustment.

note.para: When adjusting the pivot bolts, do not loosen the pivot bolts to the extent that the actuator will rattle or bind.

step1.para: Position the door control rod yoke to the door bracket. Turn the yoke on the threaded rod until the clevis pin slides in place. Re-install the clevis pin "C" clip and tighten the yoke jam nut ( Figure 10).
Check the operation of the door assembly, clean up any excess lubricant.
Re-install the right hand dash panel, the black door rod trim panel and overhead door cover ( Figure 11).
The adjusted doors will operate with approximately 10 to 14 lbs. of force when measured with a suitable scale with the IC Bus parked on a level surface ( Figure 12).
